alert.note: Alert for Marshall (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 9:16AM CDT until May 18 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Snake River at Alvarado affecting Marshall County. Roseau River at Roseau affecting Roseau County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... South Branch Buffalo River at Sabin affecting Clay County. Wild Rice River (MN) at Hendrum affecting Norman County. Red Lake River at Crookston affecting Polk County. Snake River below Warren affecting Marshall County. Two Rivers River near Hallock affecting Kittson County. Buffalo River near Dilworth affecting Clay County. .Recent rainfall continues to result in flooding impacts across the basin. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Snake River below Warren. * WHEN...Until late Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 71.0 feet, MODERATE FLOOD STAGE. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 72.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM CDT Saturday was 72.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 72.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 67.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
